get.summary: Retrieve a specific customer using a unique customer reference
get.description: Retrieve a specific customer using a unique customer reference. This identifier can be found in the response obtained after creating a new customer, it starts by C, e.g: C0000000

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: ID of customer to fetch

parameters.name: statuses
parameters.description: Customer statuses allowed when fetching the customer

id.description: Unique identifier for a Customer. Begins with 'C'

name.description: Customer's company name - must be unique across the Modulr platform.

id.description: Unique id for the Brand Name

items.description: BrandName

type.description:
Type of the customer, can be one of: 
1. LLC -> limited company
2. PLC -> publicly listed company
3. SOLETRADER -> sole trader
4. OPARTNRSHP -> ordinary partnership
5. LPARTNRSHP -> limited partnership
6. LLP -> limited liability partnership
7. CHARITY -> charity
8. INDIVIDUAL -> individual consumer
9. PCM_INDIVIDUAL -> partner clearing model individual consumer
10. PCM_BUSINESS -> partner clearing model business consumer

status.description: Status of the Customer. Customers must be 'Active' for Accounts to be created for them.

verificationStatus.description:
How the identity of the Customer has been verified. Can be: 
1. UNVERIFIED -> no verification checks have been completed
2. VERIFIED -> verification checks completed satisfactorily
3. EXVERIFIED -> verification completed externally
4. REFERRED -> verification is pending manual review
5. DECLINED -> verification is complete with a negative result
6. REVIEWED -> verification check has been reviewed

companyRegNumber.description: The company registration / incorporation number of the company. Only applicable for companies registered with Companies House

expectedMonthlySpend.description: Indication of the monthly spend of the customer.

associates.description: Array of associate objects that link to the Customer. For example, this could contain the details of the company directors for a Limited company, or or the partners for a partnership.

id.description: Unique id for the Associate

phone.description: Associate's phone number, in international number format

applicant.description: Indicates which Associate originally applied for the Modulr account

ownership.description: The Associate's percentage ownership of the Customer

type.description: Describes the relation between the Associate and the Customer. Can be one of DIRECTOR, PARTNER, CSECRETARY, SOLETRADER, BENE_OWNER, C_INTEREST, INDIVIDUAL, PCM_INDIVIDUAL, SIGNATORY, TRUST_SETTLOR, TRUST_BENEFICIARY, TRUST_TRUSTEE, PREQUALIFIED

dateOfBirth.description: Associate's date of birth in format yyyy-MM-dd, or format yyyy-MM where day is unknown

verificationStatus.description: How the Associate was verified. Can be one of UNVERIFIED, VERIFIED, EXVERIFIED, REFERRED, DECLINED, REVIEWED, MIGRATED

documentInfo.description: Documents gathered during Customer Due Diligence checks on an Associate.

uploadedDate.description: Valid date. Format is 'yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ' where Z is UTC offset. e.g 2017-01-28T01:01:01+0000

items.description: Document

type.description: The type of Additional Personal Identifier

items.description: AdditionalPersonalIdentifier

complianceData.description: Optional for associates of type C_INTEREST and an EU customer legal entity. Mandatory for associates of type PREQUALIFIED. Not to be set for other associate types and/or for UK customer legal entity.

items.description: Associate

tcsVersion.description: Version of the Modulr Account Terms and Conditions the Customer has agreed to.

documentInfo.description: Array of document objects that relate to the Customer being created. Examples of Documents could be proof of a Company Director's identity or address, Articles of Association or a Partnership Agreement.

uploadedDate.description: Valid date. Format is 'yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ' where Z is UTC offset. e.g 2017-01-28T01:01:01+0000

items.description: Document

createdDate.description: Datetime when the customer was created.Format is 'yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ' where Z is UTC offset. e.g 2017-01-28T01:01:01+0000

id.description: Unique reference for the Delegate.

roleId.description: The id of the Role assigned to the delegate

externalReference.description: External system reference for the Delegate

status.description: Status of the Delegate.

created.description: Datetime the Delegate was created.Format is 'yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ' where Z is UTC offset. e.g 2017-01-28T01:01:01+0000

updated.description: Datetime the Delegate was last updated.Format is 'yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ' where Z is UTC offset. e.g 2017-01-28T01:01:01+0000

customerTrust.description: Trust nature for customers of type trust. Mandatory for type Trust, not to be set for non-trust customers.

taxIdentifier.description: Tax identifier for customers of type SOLETRADER. Optional for type SOLETRADER, not to be set for non-SOLETRADER customers.

taxProfile.description: Tax profile for customers of type SOLETRADER. Optional for type SOLETRADER, not to be set for non-SOLETRADER customers.

complianceData.description: Required for customers of type PREQUALIFIED. Not allowed for all other customer types.

schema.description: A Customer is a single legal entity that can have 1 or more accounts

put.summary: Edit a specific customer using a unique customer reference
put.description:
Currently editable fields:
  1. For all customer types: externalReference can be edited
  2. For all customers not requiring manual or in-house KYC verification: industryCode, registeredAddress, tcsVersions and regNumber can additionally be edited. Of those:
    • For all other customer types: name and tradingAddress can additionally be edited
    • For all types other than PCM_BUSINESS: the associate can additionally be edited

If Applicant then minimum age required is 18 years for specific partners. Required for all associate types except PCM_INDIVIDUAL.

get.summary: Get an account
get.description: Retrieve details of a particular account using its ID as a reference

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of account to fetch

parameters.name: statuses
parameters.description: Account statuses allowed when fetching the account

parameters.name: includePendingTransactions
parameters.description: Include all pending transactions in 'balance' field

id.description: Unique id for the account

balance.description: Balance of the account in format 'NN.NN'

availableBalance.description: The current available balance of the Account. Calculated by subtracting any pending payments from the current balance

currency.description: Currency of the account in ISO 4217 format

status.description: Status of the account. Accounts must be 'ACTIVE' to make and receive payments. Can be one of ACTIVE, BLOCKED, CLOSED, CLIENT_BLOCKED

sortCode.description: Bank account Sort Code

bankName.description: The name of the destination bank.

bankAddress.description: The address of the destination bank.

bankCity.description: The city in which the destination bank resides.

bankBranchName.description: The name of the destination bank's branch.

bankBranchCode.description: The code of the destination bank's branch.

bankCode.description: The code identifying the target bank on its respective national network. This is not the BIC/SWIFT code. This is known as the 'ABA code' in the U.S., 'ISFC' in India, 'routing number' in Canada, and so on.

chineseId.description: The 18 digit identification code of the beneficiary. Applies to Chinese beneficiaries only.

province.description: The province in which the beneficiary resides. Applies only to beneficiaries residing in China.

business.description: The type of the beneficiary. 'true' for businesses, 'false' otherwise.

bankCodeType.description:
The code type identifying the target bank on its respective national network.
This is known as the 'ABA code' in the U.S., 'ISFC' in India, 'routing number' in Canada, and so on.

bankCountry.description: The country in which the destination bank resides.

items.description: Account Identifier

customerId.description: Unique id of the Customer

externalReference.description: Your reference for an account

accessGroups.description: Ids of Access Groups this account belongs to

items.description: Ids of Access Groups this account belongs to

createdDate.description: Datetime when the account was created. Format is 'yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssZ' where Z is UTC offset. e.g 2017-01-28T01:01:01+0000

securedFundingLimit.description: Limit of funds available below a balance of zero

get.summary: Retrieve customers using filters
get.description: Either using unique references, such as customer ID, or filter parameters, such as verification status, get details of any customers found.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of Customer(s) to fetch

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Query parameter. ID, name or external reference of customer to search for

schema.description: Query parameter. ID, name or external reference of customer to search for

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
Type to filter, can be one of:
1. LLC -> limited company
2. PLC -> publicly listed company
3. SOLETRADER -> sole trader
4. OPARTNRSHP -> ordinary partnership
5. LPARTNRSHP -> limited partnership
6. LLP -> limited liability partnership
7. CHARITY -> charity
8. INDIVIDUAL -> individual consumer
9. PCM_INDIVIDUAL -> partner clearing model individual consumer
10. PCM_BUSINESS -> partner clearing model business consumer

schema.description:
Type to filter, can be one of:
1. LLC -> limited company
2. PLC -> publicly listed company
3. SOLETRADER -> sole trader
4. OPARTNRSHP -> ordinary partnership
5. LPARTNRSHP -> limited partnership
6. LLP -> limited liability partnership
7. CHARITY -> charity
8. INDIVIDUAL -> individual consumer
9. PCM_INDIVIDUAL -> partner clearing model individual consumer
10. PCM_BUSINESS -> partner clearing model business consumer

parameters.name: verificationStatus
parameters.description:
Verification Status to filter, can be one of:
1. UNVERIFIED -> no verification checks have been completed
2. VERIFIED -> verification checks completed satisfactorily
3. EXVERIFIED -> verification completed externally
4. REFERRED -> verification is pending manual review
5. DECLINED -> verification is complete with a negative result
6. REVIEWED -> verification check has been reviewed

type.description:
Type of the customer, can be one of: 
1. LLC -> limited company
2. PLC -> publicly listed company
3. SOLETRADER -> sole trader
4. OPARTNRSHP -> ordinary partnership
5. LPARTNRSHP -> limited partnership
6. LLP -> limited liability partnership
7. CHARITY -> charity
8. INDIVIDUAL -> individual consumer
9. PCM_INDIVIDUAL -> partner clearing model individual consumer
10. PCM_BUSINESS -> partner clearing model business consumer

status.description: Status of the Customer. Customers must be 'Active' for Accounts to be created for them.

verificationStatus.description:
How the identity of the Customer has been verified. Can be: 
1. UNVERIFIED -> no verification checks have been completed
2. VERIFIED -> verification checks completed satisfactorily
3. EXVERIFIED -> verification completed externally
4. REFERRED -> verification is pending manual review
5. DECLINED -> verification is complete with a negative result
6. REVIEWED -> verification check has been reviewed

createdDate.description: Datetime the request was created. Format is 'yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.sssZ' where Z is UTC offset. e.g '2017-01-28T01:01:01.010+0000'

externalReference.description: external reference if provided

details.description: All the details of the payment from the original request

approvalStatus.description: Current approval status of payment. Can be one of [NOTNEEDED, PENDING, APPROVED, REJECTED, DELETED]

schemeInfo.description: Information with regards to the payment scheme

items.description: Full details of all payments in this batch

total.description: Total count of payment requests in this batch

inprogress.description: Count of payment requests in progress

info.description: Additional information or error message regarding this batch payment request

summary.description: Summary of the state of payment requests in this batch

get.summary: Retrieve a specific notification by unique reference for a specific partner
get.description: This allows you to see the settings for a particular notification that has been set up, for example if you want to check if it is active or the emails the notification is being sent to. It would be best practice to call this before updating a notification.

id.description: Unique Identifier for the notification.

customerId.description: Unique Identifier for the customer of this notification.

channel.description: Channel used to send the notification.

status.description: Status of notification.

destinations.description: A list of emails or url(webhook) used to send the notification. For 'EMAIL' channel this can be a list of comma separated email addresses. For 'WEBHOOK' channel this will be a single URL.

items.description: A list of emails or url(webhook) used to send the notification. For 'EMAIL' channel this can be a list of comma separated email addresses. For 'WEBHOOK' channel this will be a single URL.

threshold.description: Amount threshold which triggers the notification. This attribute only applies to 'EMAIL' notifications channel, of type 'PAYIN', 'PAYOUT'.

timesToRun.description: Times of the day when to trigger the notification. This attribute applies only to 'EMAIL' notifications channel, of type 'BALANCE'.

items.description: Times of the day when to trigger the notification. This attribute applies only to 'EMAIL' notifications channel, of type 'BALANCE'.

daysToRun.description: Days of the week when to trigger the notification. This attribute applies only to 'EMAIL' notifications channel, of type 'BALANCE'.

items.description: Days of the week when to trigger the notification. This attribute applies only to 'EMAIL' notifications channel, of type 'BALANCE'.

retry.description: Flag indicating whether failed webhooks should be retried. This attribute applies only to 'WEBHOOK' notifications channel.

secret.description: Mandatory for webhook. Secret that is used in HMAC calculation, for webhooks. This attribute applies only to 'WEBHOOK' notifications channel.

hmacAlgorithm.description: Signing algorithm that is used in Webhook HMAC calculation. This attribute only applies to 'WEBHOOK' notifications channel.

post.description:
Restores a previously suspended card to the status it was in prior to being suspended as applied by the issuer or program manager.
Use of this endpoint is `Restricted`, depending on access being granted through contractual setup with Modulr.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the card which should no longer be suspended

post.description: Unblocking a card re-enables normal authorisation processing.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the card which should be unblocked

post.description:
Suspends a card to temporarily prevent any new authorisations as applied by the issuer or the program manager (i.e. not cardholder elective). This means that all new authorisations will be immediately declined. Outstanding authorisations are unaffected and settlement, chargebacks, refunds, etc will continue to function as normal.
Use of this endpoint is `Restricted`, depending on access being granted through contractual setup with Modulr.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the card which should be suspended

post.description: Create a token that is used as a parameter to retrieve secure card details (PAN, CVV, and PIN) or to perform PIN alterations. This token is to be retrieved by the partner and pushed to the cardholder device where the call is made. The token will be valid for 60 seconds.

parameters.name: X-MOD-CARD-MGMT-TOKEN
parameters.description: Card Management Token required when the token will be used to alter card details

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the card to generate the token

publicKey.description: Base64 UTF-8 encoded RSA public key to be used to encrypt the token in the response. The key must be at least 4096 bits in length.

purpose.description: What the token will be used for. UPDATE tokens cannot be used for READ purposes, and READ tokens cannot be used for updates.

token.description: The token to use by the client for retrieving card details. Where 'encrypted' is true, this will be a value that must be decrypted on the client device before being used in subsequent API calls

encryptedSymmetricKey.description: Base64 UTF-8 encoded Symmetric key used to encrypt token, encrypted with client's public key. Only provided if 'encrypted' is true.

initialisationVector.description: Base64 UTF-8 encoded initialisation vector used with symmetric key for encrypting the token. Only provided if 'encrypted' is true.

post.description: Cancelling a card _**permanently**_ disables authorisation processing & _**destroys**_ the card from the card scheme perspective. post.description: Initiate a new standing order to the specified destination account from an account held at an ASPSP.

aspspId.description: Identifier for ASPSP being used for the standing order

type.description: Indicates the type of destination. Can be one of ACCOUNT, SCAN

id.description: Identifier of the destination account if using ACCOUNT type

accountNumber.description: Account Number of destination account if using SCAN type

sortCode.description: Sort Code of destination account if using SCAN type

name.description: Name of destination account if using SCAN type (this may be truncated)

destination.description: The destination account for the payment

currency.description: Currency of the account in ISO 4217 format. Default is GBP

recurringAmount.description: Recurring amount of the payment in Major Currency Units - '1' = 1.00 GBP

amount.description: The amount of the standing order

reference.description: Reference to be used for the Payment. This will appear on the Account statement/the recipient's bank account. Min 6 to max 18 characters. Can contain alphanumeric, '-', '.', '&', '/' and space.

payment.description: The payment of the standing order

frequency.description: Type of the capability, can be one of WEEKLY, MONTHLY

initialDate.description: The date on which the standing order should begin. This must be at least 3 days in the future from today. Date format 'yyyy-MM-dd'

finalDate.description: The optional date on which the standing order should end. If unspecified, the standing order will continue until cancelled.This must be at least 3 days in the future from today. Date format 'yyyy-MM-dd'

schedule.description: The schedule of the standing order

paymentContextCode.description: Indicates type of Payment Context, can be one of BILLPAYMENT, ECOMMERCEGOODS, ECOMMERCESERVICES, OTHER, PARTYTOPARTY. If no value or paymentContext is provided, PARTYTOPARTY is considered the default value.

deliveryAddress.description: Information that locates and identifies a specific address, as defined by postal services or in free format text, must be specified if paymentContextCode is ECOMMERCEGOODS

categoryCode.description: Merchant category code conform to ISO 18245, related to the type of services or goods provided for the transaction. Must be specified if paymentContextCode is either ECOMMERCEGOODS or ECOMMERCESERVICES

customerId.description: Merchant customer identification, must be specified if paymentContextCode is either ECOMMERCEGOODS or ECOMMERCESERVICES

merchant.description: Merchant details for the payment context

context.description: Payment context for the initiation request

type.description:
Type of the customer, can be one of: 
1. LLC -> limited company
2. PLC -> publicly listed company
3. SOLETRADER -> sole trader
4. OPARTNRSHP -> ordinary partnership
5. LPARTNRSHP -> limited partnership
6. LLP -> limited liability partnership
7. CHARITY -> charity
8. INDIVIDUAL -> individual consumer
9. PCM_INDIVIDUAL -> partner clearing model individual consumer
10. PCM_BUSINESS -> partner clearing model business consumer

status.description: Status of the Customer. Customers must be 'Active' for Accounts to be created for them.

verificationStatus.description:
How the identity of the Customer has been verified. Can be: 
1. UNVERIFIED -> no verification checks have been completed
2. VERIFIED -> verification checks completed satisfactorily
3. EXVERIFIED -> verification completed externally
4. REFERRED -> verification is pending manual review
5. DECLINED -> verification is complete with a negative result
6. REVIEWED -> verification check has been reviewed

type.description:
Type of the customer, can be one of: 
1. LLC -> limited company
2. PLC -> publicly listed company
3. SOLETRADER -> sole trader
4. OPARTNRSHP -> ordinary partnership
5. LPARTNRSHP -> limited partnership
6. LLP -> limited liability partnership
7. CHARITY -> charity
8. INDIVIDUAL -> individual consumer
9. PCM_INDIVIDUAL -> partner clearing model individual consumer
10. PCM_BUSINESS -> partner clearing model business consumer

status.description: Status of the Customer. Customers must be 'Active' for Accounts to be created for them.

verificationStatus.description:
How the identity of the Customer has been verified. Can be: 
1. UNVERIFIED -> no verification checks have been completed
2. VERIFIED -> verification checks completed satisfactorily
3. EXVERIFIED -> verification completed externally
4. REFERRED -> verification is pending manual review
5. DECLINED -> verification is complete with a negative result
6. REVIEWED -> verification check has been reviewed

customerId.description: Merchant customer identification, must be specified if paymentContextCode is either ECOMMERCEGOODS or ECOMMERCESERVICES

merchant.description: Merchant details for the payment context

context.description: Payment context for the initiation request
